total_subquestions_ys: Q1: Identify the cells that have a non-zero value in the input grid.
Q2: For each non-zero cell, check if there are any other non-zero cells in the same row.
Q3: If there are other non-zero cells in the same row, replace the zero cells between them with the value of the non-zero cell.
Q4: Repeat the process for each row in the input grid to generate the output grid.
Q1: Identify the cells that have a non-zero value in the input grid.
Q2: For each non-zero cell, check if there are any other non-zero cells in the same row.
Q3: If there are other non-zero cells in the same row, replace all the zero cells in between with the value of the first non-zero cell.
Q4: Repeat the process for each row in the grid.
Q5: Now, check for each non-zero cell if there are any other non-zero cells in the same column.
Q6: If there are other non-zero cells in the same column, replace all the zero cells in between with the value of the first non-zero cell.
Q7: Repeat the process for each column in the grid.
Q8: The final grid after all these steps will be the output grid.
